message.content:
cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.AI, cs.SE, cs.DS

This paper deals with the formal verification of the confluence property for Constraint Handling Rules (CHR), which is a programming language used for constraint solving. The paper introduces a new operational semantics for CHR and a formal meta-language for reasoning about abstract states and derivations. These topics are closely related to programming languages (cs.PL), logic (cs.LO), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), software engineering (cs.SE), and data structures (cs.DS).
